org.jscsi.initiator.connection

Class SenderWorker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jscsi.initiator.connection.SenderWorker

  • public final class SenderWorker
extends Object

    SenderWorker

    The worker caller to send all the protocol data units over the socket of this connection.

    Author:
    Volker Wildi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SenderWorker(Connection initConnection, InetSocketAddress inetAddress)
      Creates a new, empty SenderWorker instance.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      This method does all the necessary steps, which are needed when a connection should be closed.
      org.jscsi.parser.ProtocolDataUnit receiveFromWire()
      Receives a ProtocolDataUnit from the socket and appends it to the end of the receiving queue of this connection.
      void sendOverWire(org.jscsi.parser.ProtocolDataUnit unit)
      Sends the given ProtocolDataUnit instance over the socket to the connected iSCSI Target.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SenderWorker

        public SenderWorker(Connection initConnection,
            InetSocketAddress inetAddress)
             throws IOException
        Creates a new, empty SenderWorker instance.
        Parameters:
        initConnection - The reference connection of this worker caller.
        inetAddress - The InetSocketAddress of the Target.
        Throws:
        IOException - if any IO error occurs.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public final void close()
                 throws IOException
        This method does all the necessary steps, which are needed when a connection should be closed.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

      • receiveFromWire

        public org.jscsi.parser.ProtocolDataUnit receiveFromWire()
                                                  throws DigestException,
                                                         org.jscsi.exception.InternetSCSIException,
                                                         IOException
        Receives a ProtocolDataUnit from the socket and appends it to the end of the receiving queue of this connection.
        Returns:
        Queue with the resulting units
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        org.jscsi.exception.InternetSCSIException - if any violation of the iSCSI-Standard emerge.
        DigestException - if a mismatch of the digest exists.

      • sendOverWire

        public final void sendOverWire(org.jscsi.parser.ProtocolDataUnit unit)
                        throws org.jscsi.exception.InternetSCSIException,
                               IOException,
                               InterruptedException
        Sends the given ProtocolDataUnit instance over the socket to the connected iSCSI Target.
        Parameters:
        unit - The ProtocolDataUnit instances to send.
        Throws:
        org.jscsi.exception.InternetSCSIException - if any violation of the iSCSI-Standard emerge.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        InterruptedException - if another caller interrupted the current caller before or while the current caller was waiting for a notification. The interrupted status of the current caller is cleared when this exception is thrown.
